channel.title: Comments on: How to mount ISO images on Vista or Windows 7
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SqlPrincezz
item.dc:creator: SqlPrincezz
item.description: Thanks Dennis!!! Try these added steps if you have never installed MagicISO. Finally I can setup my own lab. However if I may add there there are two additional steps before "After that select Mount" step. Before this step, (if you hadn't already installed "CD/DVD Manager" before you will be prompted to go download it (so technically there are 2 downloads/installs and this 2nd step would be considered a feature/snap-in.) Then the next step is to go to Tools/Virtual CD/DVD ROM/ Create. From there you can continue with step "After that Select Mount"
item.content:encoded: Thanks Dennis!!! Try these added steps if you have never installed MagicISO. Finally I can setup my own lab. However if I may add there there are two additional steps before “After that select Mount” step. Before this step, (if you hadn’t already installed “CD/DVD Manager” before you will be prompted to go download it (so technically there are 2 downloads/installs and this 2nd step would be considered a feature/snap-in.) Then the next step is to go to Tools/Virtual CD/DVD ROM/ Create. From there you can continue with step “After that Select Mount”

item.title: By: Tim Van Wassenhove
item.dc:creator: Tim Van Wassenhove
item.description: Another tool that supports all these scenarios is Daemon tools lite (i can confirm that it works well on xp, vista and win7 x64 editions)
item.content:encoded: Another tool that supports all these scenarios is Daemon tools lite (i can confirm that it works well on xp, vista and win7 x64 editions)
